intro: Pipturus palauensis, commonly known as the Palau hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the islands of Palau in the western Pacific. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming during the wet season. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, adapted to the humid tropical environment. Pipturus palauensis plays a role in local ecosystems and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
